Package moulton.scalable.clickables

Class Button

  • java.lang.Object
    • moulton.scalable.utils.MenuComponent
      • moulton.scalable.clickables.Clickable
        • moulton.scalable.clickables.RadioButton
          • moulton.scalable.clickables.Button
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TouchResponsiveComponent
    public class Button
extends RadioButton
    A menu component that is a simple rectangular button with optional frontal text saved as text. Button is a subclass of RadioButton, but only acts as a radio button when the RadioButton.group is set to a not-null value.

    If this button is registered on the MenuManager's touch check list, then it will be responsive to mouse touching. By default, upon mouse touch the outline will toggle, but if RadioButton.colorTouched is set from non-null, then the fill color of the button will change instead.

    Author:
    Matthew Moulton

              java.awt.Font font,
              java.awt.Color color)
        Parameters:
        id - a unique string designed to identify this component when an event occurs.
        text - the string displayed on the button
        parent - the panel that this button will reside upon
        x - the x coordinate on the parent, given in menu component value format
        y - the y coordinate on the parent, given in menu component value format
        width - the width of the component, given in menu component value format
        height - the height of the component, given in menu component value format
        font - the font for the box
        color - the background color for the button when editable

    • Method Detail

      • render

        public void render​(java.awt.Graphics g,
                   int xx,
                   int yy,
                   int ww,
                   int hh)
        Draws the button onto the graphics. If this button is in a grid, it will take all of the space alloted to it. If it is in free-draw mode, then its dimensions will be decided by the string expressions for MenuComponent.x, MenuComponent.y, width, and height.

        The method RadioButton.getFillColor() will be called to determine what color the body of this button will be. The outline will be in black if it should be drawn (specified by Clickable.outline), as will the text on the face of the button, unless the button is not editable.

        Specified by:
        render in class MenuComponent
        Parameters:
        g - the graphics object to draw on
        xx - the x-position on the graphics image that this component's alloted space begins
        yy - the y-position on the graphics image that this component's alloted space begins
        ww - the width on the graphics image that this component is given
        hh - the height on the graphics image this component is given

      • setText

        public void setText​(java.lang.String text)
        Sets the text that appears on the button face to the new text.
        Parameters:
        text - the String text to replace text.

      • getText

        public java.lang.String getText()
        Returns the text that the button uses on its button face in rendering
        Returns:
        text

      • setTouched

        public void setTouched​(boolean touched)
        Sets whether this button is touched. If the touched color is unset, then an outline toggle will be used to show touch. Therefore, setting the touch here may trigger the toggle.
        Specified by:
        setTouched in interface TouchResponsiveComponent
        Overrides:
        setTouched in class Clickable
        Parameters:
        touched - whether the component is touched by the mouse: Clickable.touched.

      • setTouchedColor

        public void setTouchedColor​(java.awt.Color touchedColor)
        If touchedColor is null, then the toggle outline effect will be used instead
        Parameters:
        touchedColor - the color to be set as RadioButton.colorTouched

      • setAlignment

        public void setAlignment​(Alignment newAlignment)
        Sets the alignment for the button's text.
        Parameters:
        newAlignment - the alignment to replace alignment
